RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Standard, default armor configuration for all recruited Spartan personnel.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Recruit

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Standardized RECRUIT-class systems, vetted in DTF's 'FFG-045' combat lab.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Recruit Forearms

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Conventional RECRUIT-class full greave system manufactured on Chi Ceti IV.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Recruit Legs

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Standard SPARTAN-IV emblem.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Emblem: Recruit

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Standard VISR 4.0 for all newly deployed SPARTAN-IV assets.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Visor: Recruit

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Standard SPARTAN-IV pose.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Spartan Pose: Recruit

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Utilizes precise, three-round burst functionality, making it a formidable mid-range, semi-automatic weapon.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Weapon: Battle Rifle

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Premiere marksman rifle of the UNSC, offering impressive single-fire accuracy at reasonably long distances.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Weapon: DMR

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Enables a powerful burst of movement offering the ability to evade or quickly close the gap.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Thruster Pack

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Allows users to detect enemy signatures through walls and other hard surfaces.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Promethean Vision

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Tomcat, Triad, Bear Claw, Wasp, Campfire, Cup of Death, Active Rooster, Bulltrue, Leo, Drone
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Emblems: 10 new foregrounds!

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Fully automatic energy weapon widely considered the successor to the traditional Plasma Rifle.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Weapon: Storm Rifle

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Notable semi-automatic mid-range accuracy, firing ballistic rounds unlike most other Covenant weapons.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Weapon: Covenant Carbine

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Allows users limited flight thorugh a vertical lift propulsion system similar to that of EVA reentry packs.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Jet Pack

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Allows users to generate a nearly identical holographic decoy to deceive enemies during combat.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Hologram

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Mobility allows unlimited sprint.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Tactical Package: Mobility

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Shielding speeds up your armor's energy shield recharge rate.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Tactical Package: Shielding

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Mjolnir's mainline armor kit, designed by the Materials Group out of Damascus.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Warrior

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Twin-plate systems first saw use in 2556, but was prototyped during Mjolnir's GEN1 era.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Twin-Plated Forearms

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Imbrium Machine Complex. Counter components were developed based on intel gleaned from the Harvest Conflict.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: RG-63 Counter Legs

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Allows users to generate a protective barrier of hard light which stops most small arms fire and some explosives.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Hardight Shield

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Allows users to generate a visual effect astonishingly close to invisibility.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Active Camo

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Naphtali Contractor Corporation. Primarily used by ONI security personnel on the skyhooks above Earth and Luna.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Air Assault

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Dexterity speeds up reloads and weapon swapping.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Support Upgrade: Dexterity

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Ammo increases the ammunition capacity for both starting weapons and ordnance drops.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Support Upgrade: Ammo

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Resupply allows the recovery of grenades from fallen allies and foes.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Tactical Package: Resupply

RankAwardMetadata.Description: AA Efficiency increases the rate at which energy recharges for Armor Abilities.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Tactical Package: AA Efficiency

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Materials Group. Rigorously tested at historic DTF on the remote and rocky world of Chi Ceti IV.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Soldier

RankAwardMetadata.Description: An automated turret which can be deployed to defend its user or command a key battlefield chokepoint.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Autosentry

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Allows users to release a short-range energy field that heals any nearby Spartans.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor Ability: Regen Field

RankAwardMetadata.Description: MANUFACTURER: Hannibal Weapon Systems. Recommended armor systems for Broadsword A/X engagement pilots.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Armor: Aviator

RankAwardMetadata.Description: The Pulse Grenade forcefully detonates and forms a hazardous ionization sphere which eventually collapses, destroying any nearby targets.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Weapon: Pulse Grenade

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Forerunner particle dilator used for both its precision at mid-range and its burst functionality when up close.
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Weapon: Boltshot

RankAwardMetadata.Description: Atomic, Grunt, Dog Tags, Yin Yang, No Camping, Radioactive, Crosshairs, Anchor, Runes, Cone'd
RankAwardMetadata.Name: Emblems: 10 new Foregrounds!

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:1 CH:1 UNSC joint operations begin on Requiem as Infinity mass deploys Spartan, Navy, Marine, Army and Air Force units.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Land Grab

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:1 CH:2 Covenant operations are reliant on several power stations around Requiem.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Sniper Alley

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:1 CH:3 Spartan Fireteams are engaging enemy forces across Requiem. Enemy forces are surprisingly resilient.
ChapterMetadata.Title: The Challenge

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:1 CH:4 Infinity Science requests a Spartan Fireteam scout a suspicious structure. Caution advised.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Sacred

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:1 CH:5 Covenant archeological teams operating on Requiem are searching for something. Infinity Command wants to know what.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Core

EpisodeMetadata.Description: UNSC Infinity embarks on a mission to the Forerunner world of Requiem.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Departure

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:2 CH:1 Marine forces have failed to neutralize a Covenant stronghold and are requesting Spartan assistance.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Clean Up

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:2 CH:2 An Infinity Science team issued a distress call, then went silent. There has been no contact since.
ChapterMetadata.Title: For Science

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:2 CH:3 Marine squad Hacksaw is pinned down and requests Spartan assistance.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Hacksaw

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:2 CH:4 Fireteam Crimson has been shot down.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Pelican Down

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:2 CH:5 Science Team Gagarin, last seen researching location codenamed Refuge, is MIA. No distress call.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Gagarin

EpisodeMetadata.Description: An artifact brought onboard Infinity endangers the crew.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Artifact

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:3 CH:1 Parg Vol, a known Sangheili terrorist and associate of Jul 'Mdama, is confirmed to be on Requiem.
ChapterMetadata.Title: The VIP

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:3 CH:2 UNSC Science base Galileo requires assistance repelling enemy advances.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Galileo

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:3 CH:3 Marine squad Mountain has crashed behind enemy lines and requests immediate evac.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Spartan Mountain

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:3 CH:4 Fireteam Crimson's attempted rescue of Mountain Squad has gone sideways. Situation developing.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Shootout In Valhalla

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:3 CH:5 Covenant terrorist Parg Vol has been located again. There is no better opportunity to eliminate him.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Hunting Trip

EpisodeMetadata.Description: The infamous Doctor Catherine Halsey is brought onboard Infinity.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Catherine

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:4 CH:1 We have discovered Covenant are using a Requiem comm net to communicate secretly.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Hairy Call

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:4 CH:2 Information from comm network tap has led to the possible location of Jul 'Mdama.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Rally Point

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:4 CH:3 During previous Op, Fireteam Crimson stepped through a portal. Current whereabouts unknown.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Random Transport

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:4 CH:4 Jul 'Mdama continues to flee through Requiem's portal system. Fireteam Crimson is giving chase.
ChapterMetadata.Title: The Chase

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:4 CH:5 Although 'Mdama escaped, 'the Didact's Gift' was successfully retrieved and is being held at Galileo Base.
ChapterMetadata.Title: The Didact's Gift

EpisodeMetadata.Description: The crew of Infinity encounters cult leader Jul 'Mdama, aka The Didact's Hand.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Didact's Hand

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:5 CH:1 Infinity Science requests Spartan aid investigating anomalies in Requiem-wide portal system.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Spartan Miller

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:5 CH:2 Infinity Science has begun to understand Requiem's portal system and request assistance in its testing.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Nothing Can Go Wrong

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:5 CH:3 The Refuge facility is the focus of heavy enemy activity. Additional UNSC forces are being deployed to the area.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Everything Has Gone Wrong

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:5 CH:4 Forward Base Magma has placed a distress call. Fireteam Crimson is responding.
ChapterMetadata.Title: The Cauldron Base

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:5 CH:5 Spartan Gabriel Thorne has been transported to Requiem, without weapons or comms. His current status is unknown.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Spartan Thorne

EpisodeMetadata.Description: Infinity discovers the truth about Forerunner Prometheans.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Memento Mori

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:6 CH:1 All contact has been lost with Fireteam Crimson. Last seen facing insurmountable odds, they were either killed or captured. Infinity will continue attempting to establish their status.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Escape Plan

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:6 CH:2 En route to rendezvous with Infinity, Fireteam Crimson has been forced to land at Covenant control facility. Spartans are investigating structure's purpose.
ChapterMetadata.Title: All The Secrets

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:6 CH:3 Surveillance revealed an underground Covenant intelligence base. Fireteam Crimson is deployed to dig up information on Covenant operations.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Need To Know

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:6 CH:4 In reaction to intel extracted from Covenant control, Fireteam Switchback is investigating a Covenant archeological dig while Fireteam Crimson disrupts a Covenant supply depot.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Shut Down

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:6 CH:5 Covenant employing a Harvester in their search for a mysterious artifact. Spartans are deployed to shut down its operations.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Switchback

EpisodeMetadata.Description: Spartan Thorne is hunted by a deadly Elite assassin.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Scattered

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:7 CH:1 All fireteams are recalled to UNSC Infinity to repel Covenant invasion.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Backup

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:7 CH:2 Infinity hanger bay is overrun by with Covenant forces. Fireteam Crimson routed to eliminate hostile force.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Home Field

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:7 CH:3 Havok nukes have been detected near Infinity engine rooms
ChapterMetadata.Title: Engine of Destruction

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:7 CH:4 Covenant forces en route to retake Infinity engine room. Spartans are to defend against further incursion.
ChapterMetadata.Title: The Guns of Infinity

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:7 CH:5 Covenant threat has been neutralized, but scattered hostiles remain onboard Infinity. Fireteam Crimson are volunteered for cleanup duty
ChapterMetadata.Title: Victory Lap

EpisodeMetadata.Description: Infinity must fend off an attack by Forerunner Prometheans.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Invasion

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:8 CH:1 Fireteam Crimson redeployed to finish clearing out remaining Covenant hostiles at Apex
ChapterMetadata.Title: Unfinished Business

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:8 CH:2 Fireteam Majestic faces heavy fire from Covenant artillery and are requesting backup. Fireteam Crimson is being sent in to kick some ass.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Majestic Rescue

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:8 CH:3 Fireteam Lancer has detected some covenant nests in Warrens. Spartans are inbound on their position
ChapterMetadata.Title: Lancer

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:8 CH:4 Fireteam Crimson dispatched to investigate how the Covenant have been anticipating UNSC movements.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Crystal Ball

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:8 CH:5 Dr. Glassman has requested the assistance of Spartans in decoding a map recovered from the Covenant. Fireteam Crimson are inbound to assist.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Glassman

EpisodeMetadata.Description: The Promethean's attack comes to a disturbing end.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Expendable

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:9 CH:1 Jul 'Mdama has abducted Dr. Catherine Halsey. All fireteams dispatched to investigate her whereabouts
ChapterMetadata.Title: The Search for Halsey

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:9 CH:2 Fireteam Crimson dispatched to back up Boa Squad in holding UNSC base at Covenant Control.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Clean Up

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:9 CH:3 Spartans deployed to investigate Halsey transmission at Apex. Scorpion tank drop requested.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Science Mountain

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:9 CH:4 Covenant detention facility targeted for shut down. Spartans on the ground to level structure.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Revenge

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:9 CH:5 Numerous Covenant forces inbound on Lockup. UNSC ground teams are holding the area and request Spartan reinforcements.
ChapterMetadata.Title: The Hammer

EpisodeMetadata.Description: Doctor Halsey makes contact with the Forerunner known as Librarian.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Key

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:10 CH:1 Shield world Requiem is highly unstable and on a trajectory to collide with its sun. Fireteams Crimson and Majestic are in pursuit of artifacts needed to halt the planet's course.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Artifact

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:10 CH:2 Fireteam Crimson is en route through Warrens to acquire the replacement Harvester power supply stored at Apex.
ChapterMetadata.Title: In One Way

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:10 CH:3 Numerous Pelicans have been shot down while trying to recover the power supply for the Covenant Harvester. Fireteam Crimson is searching for survivors while recovering the replacement part.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Seize the Power

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:10 CH:4 Pelican dispatched to retrieve Fireteam Crimson and the Harvester power supply, but Covenant forces are converging on their location in Warrens.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Out the Other

ChapterMetadata.Description: EP:10 CH:5 Requiem's impact with sun is imminent. Spartans are deployed to the Covenant Harvester with the replacement power supply.
ChapterMetadata.Title: Try it Again

EpisodeMetadata.Description: UNSC Infinity must escape a deadly trap.
EpisodeMetadata.Title: Exodus

SpecializationMetadata.Description: As per Regulation 3A-950, standard Mjolnir armor configurations are available for all new Spartan recruits.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Spartan-IV

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for stealth operations which focus on the elimination of an enemy target with the goal of leaving no tactical footprint behind.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Wetwork

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for the operation and control of a wide-range of vehicles, space, air, ground, and sea.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Operator

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for deployment into uncharted, hostile territory (such as uncolonized worlds or Forerunner installations) for the purpose of gathering/relaying information.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Pioneer

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for deep, unconventional deployment within unknown enemy territory and with little to no assistance from Command.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Pathfinder

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for the subversion, repair, and/or reconstitution of a wide range of technology, including Covenant and Forerunner complex networks.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Engineer

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for target shadowing missions which require tactical invisibility despite operating at an extremely close range to the target itself.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Stalker

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for single-operative missions which require a Spartan to be deployed on their own for incredibly long durations of time, even years if required.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Rogue

SpecializationMetadata.Description: Spartan optimization for long-range target tracking (trans-continent and off-world), particularly in scenarios where conventional tracking has failed or such a substantial time has passed that the trail has gone cold.
SpecializationMetadata.Name: Tracker
